intro: Dockrillia × grimesii, commonly known as the hybrid dockrillia, is a perennial plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of streams. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a range of morphological variations compared to its parent species.
